intro: Oldenlandia nematocaulis var. nematocaulis, commonly known as the slender leaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale blue flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its genus.
